admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Project Completion Report
            (PCR) of the Land Titling Project (LTP) in Thailand. The
            overall outcome of the project as rated satisfactory; the
            performance of the Bank and the borrower was rated
            satisfactory. The project aimed at implementing the first
            5-year phase of a 20-year national land titling program and
            rationalizing cadastral mapping and documentation for the
            compilation of a national cadastre. The important lessons
            learned are :(a) For systematic title adjudication, national
            land use and classification policies must be addressed in an
            integrated manner before project implementation. (b) The
            provincial and branch land offices need to be integrated
            within the management structure of Department of Lands (DOL)
            with clear lines of authority and reporting. (c) Reliable
            land parcel statistics are needed to provide a sound basis
            for planning. (d) Sustainability of technical change
            requires parallel institutional change. (e) Human resource
            management is a key aspect of institutional development.
            Incentives for career advancement and improvement must be
            provided to staff to enhance their skills and to retain them
            in the positions for which they are trained.
